titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the William C. Wampler Congressional Papers, 1953-1990
titlestmt.subtitle: Wampler, William C., Congressional Papers Ms1982-003

change.item: Laurel Rozema added the inventory and most of the finding aid notes. She also updated the basic description, finding aid data, and names/subjects.

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1982-003

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: William C. Wampler Congressional Papers, 1953-1990 (Bulk, 1967-1982)
did.physloc: Please note: This collection is in off-site storage. Please contact Special Collections for more information.
did.abstract: William C. Wampler, Sr. was a U.S. Congressman from Virginia in the 1950s through 1980s. His papers primarily document his tenure in Congress during the 1970s and 1980s, including correspondence with constituents, committees, and government departments, legislative files, public relations and campaign materials, and photographs.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from William C. Wampler Congressional Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: William C. Wampler Congressional Papers, Ms1982-003, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: William C. Wampler Congressional Papers was donated in three accessions to Special Collections in 1982, 1984, and 1988.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the William C. Wampler Congressional Papers was completed in August 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Creed Wampler, Sr. (1926-2012) was a Congressman from Virginia from 1953 to 1955 and 1967 to 1983. He served in the U.S. Navy during World War II before graduating from Virginia Polytechnic Institute (VPI) in 1948 and studying law at the University of Virginia. Wampler became a journalist in Virginia and Tennessee, while also supporting the work of the Republican Party in the Ninth Congressional District. In 1953, he was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives from Virginia, losing his seat in 1955. Wampler then joined the Atomic Energy Commission and in 1957 became the vice president and manager of the Wampler Brothers Furniture Company, followed by the Wampler Carpet Company in 1961, in Bristol. In 1967, he left the company upon succesfully winning his election to the U.S. House of Representatives, serving until he lost his seat once more in 1983. Wampler also served on the boards of visitors of Emory and Henry College and of VPI.
Source: Wampler, William Creed (1926-2012), entry in Biographical Directory of the United States Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The William C. Wampler Congressional Papers include legislative files, committee files (House Agriculture Committee, Select Committee on Aging, etc.), constituency correspondence, U.S. and Virginia government departmental files, public relations and campaign material, and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by box.
